tutorial.speak:
Sometimes you have information you want repeated on multiple pages. Blocks are where you can store this information so you can edit a single copy.
To get started click the Plus icon next to Reusable Blocks
Give it a name and choose whether this block contains a group of sections or elements. See the tutorial on Sections and Elements for more information.
Your empty block has been created. Click on it to begin adding content.
You'll be on a screen that looks like the page editor, but just for this single block.
Like with pages, click the Add Button.
You'll notice a few options are missing. Since this is a block of elements only, you cannot add a section. You can also not add other blocks.
Drag elements onto the page to create the content and click done. See the tutorial on elements to learn more.
This block can now be added to any page. Click on one of the pages in the main navigation.
And edit it's con-tent.
Now when you go to add elements to the page, your block will be available in the list.
Simply drag it onto any section and it will be added with the color and styling from that section.
